The other [seed syllables] are assigned to the forehead and so forth. The syllable a is the adamantine jewel ground, because it is held by the great compassion ground. The syllable vi is the nourishing of the merit milk ocean. The syllable ra is the nurturing by the torch of samÄdhi wisdom. The syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ is the unfolding by the wisdom wind that removes obstacles. The syllable khaá¹ƒ is the unobstructed boundless nature of emptiness.
After first arranging the five parts, next the characteristics of yoga are explained.
The syllable a is the true golden color, universally emitting the adamantine wheel.
Empowering the lower body is called the yoga seat.
The syllable vi is the pure moon light, not in the midst of mist and clouds.
Empowering above the waist is called the great compassion ocean.
The syllable ra is the initial sunlight, shaped like a triangle, red in color.
Empowering the heart position is called the majestic wisdom fire.
The syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ is the fire of the kalpa, smeared with the wind wheel of the dark void.
Empowering the white tuft between the eyebrows is called the power of mastery.
The syllable ka arises from great emptiness and contains all forms.
Empowering it above the head is therefore called the unsurpassed one.
Next, the five branches are assigned to earth, water, fire, wind, and space to form the altar.
Contemplate the syllable a below the seat.
The vajra seat is already formed.
Its color is like gold.
This is the meaning of precepts.
The appearance of the altar is square.

This is the meaning of concentration.
The appearance of the altar is round, like a full moon.
Contemplate the syllable ra in the heart.
Its appearance and color are red,
representing the meaning of wisdom.
The altar is triangular in shape.
The outer altar is also triangular.
Contemplate the syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ between the eyebrows.
Its color is black, the unobstructed wind.
This is the meaning of liberation.
Contemplate the altar as blue, shaped like a half-moon.
The appearance of the outer altar is also the same.
The syllable oá¹ƒ is placed on top of the head.
It forms the great empty dot.
This is the meaning of the knowledge and vision of liberation.
The meaning of the syllable oá¹ƒ is like this.
The empty dot has no form or appearance.
It is able to accomplish all activities.
This is the meaning of the dhÄraá¹‡Ä«.
